Sequence Information.Peptide Name: C2-4 (CATH-2(1-15) analog, synthetic AMPs, Arg-rich, UCLL1)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, avian cathelicidin analog, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature.Author: Hao S, Shi W, Chen L, Kong T, Wang B, Chen S, Guo X.2024
Literature.Reference: Front Cell Infect Microbiol. 2024 May 15;14:1390934. doi: 10.3389/fcimb.2024.1390934.PubMed
Literature.Title: CATH-2-derived antimicrobial peptide inhibits multidrug-resistant Escherichia coli infection in chickens.

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (86.67%) toCATH-2(1-15)R: 33%, F=K: 13%.Activity: active against E. coli ATCC 8739 or 6 resistant E strains (MIC 16-128 ug/ml). Warning: other bacteria not tested.In vitro toxicity: chicken RBC: <10% hemolysis at 64 ug/ml (slightly hemo.lytic). At this concentration, ~90% chicken kidney cells survived.
